hackathon-description-text: Come join us on February 2nd - 3rd to engage in critical conversations regarding healthcare and pharmacy with industry giants and leading researchers. We want everyone - pharmacy students, engineers, designers, and more - to come and help solve some of the biggest challenges facing the world today.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Computer Vision Programmer at CapSen Robotics and Part-time Instructor at University of Pittsburgh
Professor and Senior Associate Dean at the University of Pittsburgh School of Pharmacy
Associate Director for Pharmacogenomics of the Pitt/UPMC Institute of Precision Medicine
Lead Innovation Advisor, Pharmacy and Therapeutics at University of Pittsburgh School of Pharmacy
Administrative Director of Pharmacy at UPMC Presbyterian
Innovation Core Manager for the Clinical & Translational Science Institute

hackathon-eligibility: All students 18 and older are eligible to participate in the Pitt Challenge. Teams may have up to 4 people.
hackathon-rules:
The Pitt Challenge follows the MLH Code of Conduct, to be found 
.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Fitbit Alta for each team member
$250 AWS Credit for each team member
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi & PiHut Essential Kit for each team member
Sports Headphones for each team member
Google Home Mini for each team member

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=123 University Pl, Pittsburgh, PA 15213, USA
hackathon-description-header: Come change the way the world looks at health.
